definition: to resemble one another/to be alike/similar
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: Over time because of all the empathising they are doing, their faces come to look more similar.
sentences.chinese: 時間一長他們的臉會越來越相像。

sentences.english: The two sisters are as like as two peas.
But I concluded that no one ruin is like another.
sentences.chinese: 但我斷定沒有一個廢墟與另外的是相像的。

sentences.english: Orb 2 accurately mimics the type of orbs reproduced by dust particles.
sentences.chinese: 2號光點與拍攝塵埃微粒複製出的那類光點十分相像。

sentences.english: Such cognate words don't necessarily mean the same.
sentences.chinese: 很必然地，這些原本的同源詞看上去就並不相像了。

sentences.english: The fruit is rather like a sweet chestnut.
sentences.chinese: 這顆果實與甘慄頗爲相像。

sentences.english: A cat is similar to a tiger in some way.
The microphone, you see, acts much like a telephone transmitter .
sentences.chinese: 你看，傳聲器作用與電話的送話器很相像。

sentences.english: FIFTY years ago Egypt looked oddly similar to another country.
sentences.chinese: 五十年前，埃及看起來和另一個國家非常相像。

sentences.english: They are so alike, I can't tell which is which .
sentences.chinese: 他們是那樣相像，我都分不出誰是誰了。

sentences.english: In certain aspects , the two poems are very much alike.
sentences.chinese: 在某些方面這兩首詩挺相像。

sentences.english: There was a wonderful similarity between the twins.
sentences.chinese: 這對孿生兒相像得驚人。

sentences.english: Kehr bears a strong facial resemblance to her sister.
sentences.chinese: 凱爾的容貌和她姐姐十分相像。

sentences.english: The misunderstanding over the word happened because of two similar-looking kinds of birds.
sentences.chinese: 對這個詞的誤解來自於兩隻非常相像的鳥。

sentences.english: Gold is similar in colour to brass.
sentences.chinese: 黃金和黃銅的顏色很相像。

sentences.english: There are much likeness between the two cousins.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個表姐妹非常相像。

definition: similar in expression and spirit/to bear a remarkable resemblance to
exactly the same (idiom)/carbon copy/also pr. [yi1 mo2 yi1 yang4]
to be precisely the same/to be no different
to be a good fit/to be identical with/to adjust oneself to/to fit in
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
